00035 #ifdef HAVE_SIGNAL
00036 #include <signal.h>
00037 
00038 static SyxOop sigint_class,
00039   sigfpe_class,
00040   sigterm_class,
00041   sigabrt_class;
00042 
00043 static void
00044 _syx_smalltalk_sighandler (int signum)
00045 {
00046   SyxOop klass;
00047   SyxErrorType errtype;
00048 
00049   switch (signum)
00050     {
00051     case SIGINT:
00052       klass = sigint_class;
00053       errtype = SYX_ERROR_USER_INTERRUPT;
00054       break;
00055     case SIGFPE:
00056       klass = sigfpe_class;
00057       errtype = SYX_ERROR_FLOATING_POINT_EXCEPTION;
00058       break;
00059     case SIGTERM:
00060       klass = sigterm_class;
00061       errtype = SYX_ERROR_TERMINATION;
00062       break;
00063     case SIGABRT:
00064       klass = sigabrt_class;
00065       errtype = SYX_ERROR_ABORT;
00066       break;
00067     default:
00068       printf ("Unknown signal %d has been handled\n", signum);
00069       return;
00070     }
00071 
00072   signal (signum, _syx_smalltalk_sighandler);
00073   syx_signal (errtype, syx_nil);
00074 }
00075 
00076 static void
00077 _syx_save_recovered_image (void)
00078 {
00079   SyxOop process = syx_processor_active_process;
00080   syx_string image_path;
00081   syx_symbol cur_image_path = SYX_OBJECT_SYMBOL (syx_globals_at ("ImageFileName"));
00082   
00083   image_path = (syx_string) syx_calloc (strlen (cur_image_path) + 9, sizeof (syx_char));
00084   sprintf(image_path, "%s.recover", cur_image_path);
00085 
00086   if (SYX_IS_NIL (process))
00087     {
00088       printf("\nCan't save a recovered copy of the image at %s.\n", image_path);
00089       return;
00090     }
00091 
00092   /* Remove the affected process */
00093   syx_scheduler_remove_process (process);
00094 
00095   if (!syx_memory_save_image (image_path))
00096     printf("\nCan't save a recovered copy of the image at %s.\n", image_path);
00097   else
00098     printf("\nRecovered copy of the image has been created at %s.\n", image_path);
00099 }

00101 static void
00102 _syx_internal_sighandler (int signum)
00103 {
00104   switch (signum)
00105     {
00106     case SIGILL:
00107       puts ("***** Illegal Instruction *****");
00108       break;
00109     case SIGSEGV:
00110       puts ("***** Segmentation Violation *****");
00111       break;
00112     default:
00113       printf ("***** Unknown signal %d *****\n", signum);
00114       break;
00115     }
00116   
00117   syx_show_traceback ();
00118   _syx_save_recovered_image ();
00119   puts ("\nPlease send the above bug report to \"lethalman88@gmail.com\".");
00120   exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
00121 }
00122 #endif /* HAVE_SIGNAL */

00134 void
00135 syx_signal_init (void)
00136 {
00137 #ifdef HAVE_SIGNAL
00138   sigint_class = syx_globals_at ("UserInterrupt");
00139   sigfpe_class = syx_globals_at ("FloatingPointException");
00140   sigterm_class = syx_globals_at ("TerminationSignal");
00141   sigabrt_class = syx_globals_at ("AbnormalTermination");
00142   
00143   /* Internal handled signals */
00144   signal (SIGILL, _syx_internal_sighandler);
00145   signal (SIGSEGV, _syx_internal_sighandler);
00146 
00147   /* Smalltalk handled signals */
00148   signal (SIGINT, _syx_smalltalk_sighandler);
00149   signal (SIGFPE, _syx_smalltalk_sighandler);
00150   signal (SIGTERM, _syx_smalltalk_sighandler);
00151   signal (SIGABRT, _syx_smalltalk_sighandler);
00152 #endif /* HAVE_SIGNAL */
00153 }
